Theme definition: Mentions prior experience with interpolation shaping understanding.
Definition: Has prior experience with interpolation (e.g., f-strings, template literals).
When not to use: If interpolation is only mentioned generically without experience.
Example quote: I had almost no experience with string interpolation so I had to do a quick google search to fully understand the process before starting the survey.

Theme definition: Mentions prior experience with concatenation shaping understanding.
Definition: Has stronger background with '+' concatenation or similar APIs.
When not to use: If '+' is mentioned only in the example text.
Example quote: I had almost no experience with string interpolation so I had to do a quick google search to fully understand the process before starting the survey.

Theme definition: Prior familiarity made examples easier to parse and understand.
Definition: States familiarity made examples easier/faster or clearer.
When not to use: If benefit is not tied to prior experience.
Example quote: I had almost no experience with string interpolation so I had to do a quick google search to fully understand the process before starting the survey.

Theme definition: Lack of familiarity made examples harder to parse or slower to grasp.
Definition: States unfamiliarity caused difficulty or slower understanding.
When not to use: If difficulty is unrelated to familiarity.
Example quote: I had almost no experience with string interpolation so I had to do a quick google search to fully understand the process before starting the survey.

Theme definition: Reports no meaningful impact from prior experience.
Definition: States no noticeable impact of prior experience.
When not to use: If a clear impact (helped/hindered) is described.
Example quote: I had almost no experience with string interpolation so I had to do a quick google search to fully understand the process before starting the survey.

Theme definition: Describes the learning curve or speed of adapting to the unfamiliar style.
Definition: Reports adapting quickly after brief exposure.
When to use: Mentions got used to/learned quickly/after a few examples.
When not to use: If no adaptation timeline is mentioned.
Example quote: I had almost no experience with string interpolation so I had to do a quick google search to fully understand the process before starting the survey.
